title: The View from Yu-Graph by Kit Woolsey
excerpt: Analysis of hands from recent tournaments using Yu-Graph technology.

data.text:
**The View from Yu-Graph**

by Kit Woolsey, Kensington, CA

As the coach of the USA-1 team in the 1997 Bermuda Bowl, I had played during October in Tunisia, I had many opportunities to watch matches on the Vu-Graph. One nice feature of this perspective is that you get the ad-vantages of being a spectator, yet can openly discuss the deal as it is being played, gaining additional insights from the observations of others. Of course, the observations are based on seeing all four hands; most show who can see all four hands must take great care not to let knowledge of the layout affect his analysis or evaluation — the players' actions leave the players in their seats based on their information. This two-player follows the 20-board-final: USA-1 vs France. Paul Chemla was South and Michel Perron North.

**CHALLENGE THE CHAMPS**

(East hands are on page 12.)
